Tobias

$5.00 • Buy Tobias now! Pattern Purchase FAQ View on Ravelry

When it came time to knit the sample sock for this pattern, I emailed a friend and asked her “What color should I knit a sock that’s named after Tobias on Arrested Development?” And she emailed me back, “Would it be too obvious to suggest blue?”

Named after Tobias Fünke, would renowned “analrapist,” this sock is a little funky, a little strange, and a little confused by its path in life.

This pattern is written cuff-down, with instructions provided for a heel flap. Please note that this pattern is written for two circular needles and uses the abbreviation “ndl1” and “ndl2” to indicate this. If using DPNs, make sure you pay close attention to this. Instructions for different sizes are provided in brackets.

There are separate instructions for the right and left sock: you do not have to make them mirror images of each other, but they look kind of awesome that way. The cables should be on the outside of the foot. At the risk of sounding repetitive, the right sock has a cable on the right side of the foot and the left sock has the cable on the left side of the foot.

This pattern will go significantly faster if you cable without a cable needle.

Pattern Information

Gauge

28 stitches and 32 rows = 4 inches in stockinette

Yardage

yards Fingering / 4 ply (14 wpi)

Yarns

Little Red Bicycle Tandem Sock (Now with nylon!) (Fingering)

Needles

US 1 - 2.25 mm

Sizes

Small (US women's 7-7.5 shoe), Large (US women's 8-10 shoe)

Featured in Fünke Socks!

About pattern purchases

Patterns are sold as downloadable PDF files through Ravelry, with payments processed by PayPal. You do not need an account to use either service.

If you have a Ravelry account, I suggest logging in prior to purchasing so that patterns are added to your library.

Get pattern help

Pattern support is provided free of charge for all of my patterns. We respond as quickly as possible, but sometimes it can take a day or two.

Submit a new help request through Zendesk.

You can also use Zendesk to report errors and ask non-technical questions.

Alternatively, you can try the Ravelry group.

Support is only provided via Zendesk.

FAQ

Can I teach a class using your knitting pattern?

Teaching licensing is temporarily on hold and should resume in 2014.

Can I sell items made using your knitting patterns for profit or charity?

Not at this time.

How do I order wholesale copies for my LYS?

Pattern wholesaling is temporarily on hold and should resume in 2014.

I found an error, how do I report it?

Oh newts! Submit your error through Zendesk and we will fix it.

Happy knitting!
